profile_data.summary:
🌟 About Me
I am a Data Science Master’s student at Michigan Technological University, passionate about Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Software Development. I thrive on solving real-world challenges by leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies like Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and NLP-driven automation.

💡 What Drives Me?
I take inspiration from books like:
📖 The Secret – Power of mindset in achieving success
📖 Atomic Habits – The art of consistency and incremental growth
📖 The Hard Thing About Hard Things – Navigating tough challenges with resilience

🎯 What I’ve Built & Worked On
✅ AI Research Assistant (Michigan Tech) – Developed RAG-powered AI solutions, GPT-based document intelligence, and NLP-driven automation.
✅ Machine Learning Engineer (Accenture) – Built ML models for enterprise automation, integrated AI in cloud workflows, and optimized deployment pipelines.
✅ Software Engineer Intern (Cognizant) – Engineered cloud-based applications using Spring Boot, AWS, and REST APIs.
✅ AI Intern (Alliance Laundry Systems) – Developed an AI chatbot that enhanced supplier query efficiency by 40% and implemented predictive analytics for risk assessment.

✨ Beyond Tech?
I express creativity through poetry—it helps me think outside the box, see patterns where others don’t, and turn complex problems into elegant solutions.

🚀 Actively Seeking: Internships & Full-time Roles in AI, ML, and Software Engineering
📩 Let’s connect! Reach out at pamminen@mtu.edu or message me here!

honors.description:
During my undergraduate journey, I consistently strived for academic excellence, leadership, and innovation. I successfully graduated with First Class with Distinction, securing multiple internships and 3 job offers even before completing my degree.

I actively participated in hackathons, led technical certifications, and took on leadership roles to drive impactful initiatives. As an NSS volunteer, I contributed to community service and social responsibility efforts. I also served as a Student Ambassador for Verzeo, where I promoted tech education and mentorship programs, further strengthening my leadership and communication skills.

My dedication and achievements were recognized by my college, which honored me through ‘Sanmanam’—a prestigious recognition where my parents were felicitated for my accomplishments.

This journey reinforced my passion for continuous learning, problem-solving, and leadership, shaping my path toward making a meaningful impact in AI, Machine Learning, and Software Development.
honors.title: 🏅 Undergraduate Achievements & Recognition

honors.description:
Developed an innovative Driving License Reminder System App to enhance road safety and compliance, integrating MongoDB for secure data storage, Arduino for seamless hardware connectivity, and a Fingerprint Sensor for advanced biometric authentication.

This system addresses a critical road safety challenge by ensuring that only licensed and authorized drivers operate vehicles. Through real-time biometric verification, it conducts instant license validity checks, significantly reducing the risks posed by unqualified drivers. Additionally, the real-time functionality enables law enforcement to perform on-the-spot verifications at traffic stops and checkpoints, ensuring regulatory compliance efficiently.

This initiative goes beyond technology—it's a social responsibility effort to foster safer roads and responsible driving habits. By preventing unqualified drivers from operating vehicles, the system contributes to accident prevention, public safety, and law enforcement efficiency.

A key highlight of this project is the recognition and appreciation received from DRDO scientists and the Chairman, acknowledging its potential for large-scale social impact. By integrating AI-driven security measures with biometric authentication, this solution represents a proactive approach to public safety, ensuring a more secure and responsible driving environment.

By blending technology and social responsibility, this project stands as a testament to how AI and biometric security can be leveraged for positive societal change and impactful innovation.
honors.title: Driving License Reminder System – A Tech-Driven Social Responsibility Initiative(A State Level Science & Technology Contest)

projects.description:
Designed and implemented an NLP-powered book recommendation system that categorizes books into genres and suggests relevant titles based on user input
Preprocessed book descriptions using NLP techniques like tokenization, stop-word removal, and lemmatization.
Applied Word2Vec embeddings to convert text data into 300-dimensional vectors.
Trained models such as SVM and Random Forest for genre classification.
Achieved a 95% classification accuracy across 14 book genres.
Enhanced recommendation relevance by 85%, processing over 1,400 book entries efficiently.
projects.title: Book Recommendation System

member.occupation: AI Research Assistant at MTU | Ex-Accenture, Cognizant, Alliance Laundry | Generative AI | LLMs | RAG | NLP | Software & Cloud AI | Open to Opportunities

projects.description:
Developed predictive models for breast cancer diagnosis using the Breast Cancer Wisconsin (Diagnostic) dataset. The project focuses on preprocessing, feature engineering, and deploying machine learning algorithms to classify tumors as Benign or Malignant, emphasizing high accuracy and interpretability.
Applied data preprocessing techniques: correlation analysis, Box-Cox transformation, and feature scaling.
Trained models like SVM, Neural Networks, and Logistic Regression, with evaluations using ROC-AUC and confusion matrices.
Identified key predictors such as Radius, Area, and Texture metrics.
Achieved perfect test ROC-AUC of 1.0000 with SVM and 0.9997 with Neural Networks.
Delivered a robust and accurate predictive system for early breast cancer diagnosis.
projects.title: Breast Cancer Prediction System

projects.description: This project focuses on addressing critical issues surrounding data security in cloud computing through the development of an innovative Data Privacy Protection Application. The significance of data security, especially in a cloud computing environment where data is distributed globally, cannot be overstated. The existing system, represented by the Dynamic Searchable Symmetric Encryption (DSSE) framework, faced limitations due to its static nature, particularly in handling dynamic file collections. To overcome these challenges, a proposed system was introduced, featuring a weight-based attribute encryption scheme that utilized a hash function for compressing arbitrary length messages into fixed-length message digests. This approach enhanced data integrity, authentication, and key management, contributing to modern cryptography standards. Notably, the inclusion of a proxy reencryption algorithm further fortified security, generating attribute proxy reencryption keys. The application is modular, catering to Owners who register and upload files, and Users who register, download files using a 16-bit private key. The project's design encompasses system architecture illustrated through UML diagrams, including class, activity, and sequence diagrams. Implementation was carried out using tools such as Java, NetBeans IDE, and MySQL database, ensuring practicality and efficiency. In conclusion, the project emphasizes the paramount importance of safeguarding sensitive data, presenting an encrypted cloud service as a secure and widely applicable solution in contemporary data security practices.
projects.title: Data Privacy Protection Application using Cloud Computing
